titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Ivan Alekseevich Vladimirov paintings
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-08-08T14:46-0700

change.item: Revised to update Access statement and add links to digital collections site by Sarah Patton.
Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Jill Golden.

PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Ivan Alekseevich Vladimirov Paintings)//EN" "vladimia.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.unittitle: Ivan Alekseevich Vladimirov paintings
did.abstract: Depicts scenes of daily life during the Russian Revolution. Digital copies available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Originals may not be used without permission of the Archivist. Digital copies available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ivan Alekseevich Vladimirov paintings, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1924.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content note
scopecontent.p: Depicts scenes of daily life during the Russian Revolution. All works are watercolors except where otherwise indicated.

dao.title: 1. Hungry ones in Petrograd dividing a dead horse in the street

dao.title: 7. Hungry workmen in Petrograd robbing a military lorry of bread

dao.title: 8. Russian peasants returning home after pillaging a country house of a rich landlord (near Pskoff)

dao.title: 9. Russian clergymen hiding church treasures in a new grave in a cemetery (near Luga),

dao.title: 16. Hard labor for rich merchants, nobles and criminals during the years of revolution (1919-1922)

dao.title: 17. Vandalism of the revolutionaries, a scene in one of the rooms of the Winter Place

dao.title: 22. Hard labor for Russian clergymen. A group of Russian priests forced to clear the barrack stables

dao.title: 25. A man dead of hunger--a prey for hungry dogs. Drawn from nature (Petrograd)
